result.execSummary:
The defendant Jimmie L Patterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Negligent Operation of Motor Vehicle, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court Costs were waived. DNA surcharge waived, based on date of violation.
Straight Time. Sentence credit of 14 days were granted. Time Served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jimmie L Patterson

Defendant Jimmie L Patterson in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court the States request to amend the charges.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1 and 2.  The Court finds defendant guilty.  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:  Count #1:  COSTS WAIVED.   DNA surcharges/sample waived based on date of violation.Count #2: JAIL:  14 DAYS apply credit of 14 Days.  (TIME SERVED).  Court Costs:  Waived. Defendant Jimmie L Patterson in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Menden advises the Court that they are ready to proceed to trial but are still in negotiations and request to come back to court later this morning at 11:30 a.m.  The Court recalls the case with the same appearances.  The parties are not ready to proceed at  this time and the Court sets the matter over to tomorrow, Tuesday, November 10, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.  The Court will address the motion in limine or if the parties have reached an agreement the case will proceed to disposition.
